summary: This is an email chain from September 22, 2020, forwarding a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter, dated September 21, 2020, concerns discovery issues and Maxwell's prison conditions. The prosecution team is coordinating to address the defense's concerns.

events.title: Defense Letter Regarding Discovery and Prison Conditions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP, sends a formal letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office raising issues about discovery production and Maxwell's conditions at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

events.title: Prosecution Coordination on Defense Concerns
events.description: The prosecution team receives and forwards the defense's letter, and begins coordinating with MDC legal counsel, paralegals, and IT staff to address the issues raised about discovery and prison conditions.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, led by Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP, raised formal concerns with the prosecution about discovery issues and Maxwell's prison conditions at the MDC in September 2020.
The defense legal team included attorneys Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.
The prosecution acknowledged receipt of the defense letter and began internal coordination to address the raised issues.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and pre-trial motions concerning discovery and defendant welfare during Maxwell's detention.
